website_summaries.verdict: The handsome B&O Play Beoplay H9i headphones offer excellent audio quality in a luxurious design, but you can get better noise cancellation for less.
pros: Rich bass depth matched with detailed highs
Can be used in passive, wired mode
cons: Noise cancellation affects audio playback and adds hiss

customer_reviews.title: B&o quality (has reduced badly}
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable headphones with great sound. Fits my large head. I bought the h7 earpads as they are twice the thickness of the h9i. Makes them even more comfortable. UPDATE I'm afraid I am considerably reducing the rating as I am experiencing a thumping /crashing noise when walking so I returned them to b&o under warranty. That took 3 weeks to arrange and now they are saying that there isn't a problem and have returned them back to me. For a Premier company this just isn't good enough and after buying a couple of b&o products I won't be buying anymore. And these will be returned straight back to them. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Alibone

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with no patience.
customer_reviews.text: Whilst I had read several reviews, until you try something..I was excited about them, but...The build quality is great, but the volume is lacking. And trying to turn the volume up or down was so fiddly and annoying I had to return them. I also have a pair of Sony WH -1000 xm 2 headphones and the gesture controls work flawlessly. I am a bit gutted about the B&O ones but the fiddly controls would drive me mad very quickly.Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hawthorn

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful stylish headphones but terrible sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: These flagship headphones from B&O are very beautiful, stylish and made from premium materials, however when spending such an amount you expect the sound quality to be premium as well, or at least not damaging to ears. Upon using the headphones the left ear cup produces a loud screeching sound that is potentially damaging to the ear. Extremely disappointed with the sound quality, as what is the point of owning stylish headphones if they are non-functional.
customer_reviews.author: Admin Andy

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than the Sennheisers
customer_reviews.text: I've had many Sennheisers - MX450 and 550 most recently. When the second 550's broke in the same place as the first, it was time to buy something else. The B&O's were reduced in price and the reviews were good. The H9i's sound superb, especially with classical and soft rock music. The headband is more comfortable, and they will pair with more than one system at a time, picking up whichever is playing sound at the time. Also features a removable battery but with no external charger, this is not a perfect solution vs the Senns. (One star deducted for this.) Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are and great sound, good bass not too heavy, vocals that stand out and clean crisp highs. Took about half a dozen tries to pair up with samsung s9 but got there eventually. Biggest gripe is the rock hard headband. Looking at the pictures I imagined this to be padded but it is just thin material covering a hard piece of plastic. The ear cups on the other hand are luxuriously soft leather, and they look great in the natural tan colour. If it wasn't for the headband you wouldn't even feel that they were on your head!
customer_reviews.author: Crooty

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth keeps cutting out
customer_reviews.text: For once I decided to spend more than £50 on a pair of headphones, and I have always wanted to own a Bang and Olufsen product. Got it out of its box connected it to my phone very easily. The sound quality was superb as was the noise cancelling, but the controls are by gesture across the ear piece and very hard to actually get the desired affect. But more disappointingly the bluetooth kept cutting out every 30 seconds or so, so you had to keep pressing play. I am afraid these are going back, and I suspect Iwon't be buying B&O again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A.

customer_reviews.title: Bang and Olufsen headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these almost 2 months ago,and on many occasions thought about returning them,cos the touch control wasn’t working properly,only the pause worked,fingers crossed I’ve finally got them working,by removing the battery for a few secs & then syncing Them up again,dropped a star cos,of the stated problems,
customer_reviews.author: Spider

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic comfort and sound. A little bright but can be fixed via the app to your sound preference. One star dropped for the poor proximity sensor resulting in the sound pausing intermittently. Another concern is the touch sensor pad whereby changing the volume is almost impossible, causing you to either forward, rewind or pause songs accidentally. Overall, really impressed with these headphones apart from these two annoying issues.
customer_reviews.author: Adamx

customer_reviews.title: Top quality item
customer_reviews.text: Top quality item.. Sound for me was perfection on par with H6 gen 2. I had to send them back due to the pads getting uncomfortable, I will explain. They sit on your ear really not full over ear cans. I got hot ear and fatigue. They feel weighty when moving around. Touch control temprametle. If these were full over ear these would knock everything out the park. I went with the B&W PX ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: B&O are still the Rolls Royce of sound
customer_reviews.text: These are an incredible pair of headphones. I’ve had Beats, I’ve had the Nuraphones. These are in a different league. Comfortable. Extremely well made. And the sound is quite extraordinary. I wear them daily and haven’t found a type of music which they couldn’t make better. The only downside is I had to turn off the touch controls on the right ear. For some reason they throw a hissy fit from time to time and cause Bluetooth dropouts. Quite odd.
customer_reviews.author: obnixa

customer_reviews.title: Great but broke after a while
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these headphones beats bose hands down. Much more detail, these headphones are not for volume but clarity so you don't need to turn them up to appreciate the deep bass which is the best I've heard in this price range. The treble can be a bit too brilliant and needs to be reduced sometimes. Anyway I used these for a few days, they charge quickly and battery time is good. and then nothing, completely dead :(
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful...headphones
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully crafted headphones, this is my second pair of b&o headphones. They really are very well made, the sound is good and with these the noise cancelling is excellent too. Ideal for long flights or noisy train journeys. Flexible too, you can still use whilst plugged in charging... Make sure you get a good case too as you want to keep these in tip top condition..
customer_reviews.author: J.Madge

customer_reviews.title: Not for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sound isolation on these is absolutely superb, however sadly the same cannot be said for the sound quality. For this price I was expecting deep bass, crisp highs and a good medium. There is barely any base, tinkering with the audio in the app didn't yield much results either. And the volume control absolutely killed me. Maybe my touch panel was dysfunctional, but it kept not responding to my touch whenever I was trying to modify the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Lani A.

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled for a Ha'porth  of Tar
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is as you would expect from B&O, noise cancellation is out of this world, you get what you pay for, but oh, those controls, so fiddly and hit or miss as to be beyond belief. It can take minutes, beyond the end of the track, to get a delicate passage just the way you want to hear it. You can do better than this, B&O. Forget the arty crafty design, get back to simple functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie53

customer_reviews.title: Very good but arrived in a damaged box
customer_reviews.text: Product was great and is of a very high quality. However, i brought this for a gift and the box arrived damage which made me very disappointed. I hope wish this product also came with a proper hard box case. For £400 this is the least you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Not great, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: They looked great. However, their volume was really low. You really have to raise the volume quite loud to hear anything. My beats solo 3 were much better and they aren't even noise cancelling. I returned them. They also kept on falling off my head.
customer_reviews.author: Sanaa

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with these, I’m glad I spent the extra for beautiful build quality, ear protection and sound quality. They always connect easily. The ‘fingering’ instructions for on/off & pause etc take a while to remember, but otherwise just what I’d expect from a good quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom France

customer_reviews.title: Impractical for non audiophile like me
customer_reviews.text: I am not qualified to judge on the audio quality but they are not practical to use. The swipe operations to control the volume etc are impossible - give me a button. They won't connect to the phone (Samsung 10+) without re-pairing each time. The battery cover is a nightmare to get off (use rubber gloves and persevere). All designed to look sleek instead of being functional. They are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: tonykj

customer_reviews.title: Even balanced sound
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is pretty substandard, but that's not why you would spend this much for B&O. You get what you pays for and the sound (the run in) is balanced and even without exaggerated bass. Build quality is superb. Metal with good weight. Avoid the other colors as they pick up scuff marks real easy. Stick to black and it looks more discreate.
customer_reviews.author: Mr elusive

customer_reviews.title: Heavy stuff
customer_reviews.text: Nice design. I concur with the reviews seen, except I find them to be a bit heavy and stiff on my ears making them slightly less comfortable than one would expect from an expensive product like this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pye

customer_reviews.title: superb craftsmanship but hard to carry around
customer_reviews.text: i like the quality on these headphones but the weight for these headphone is a little noticeable compared to bose headphones as they are not fully assembled in plastic.As for the sound quality it is superb but I need to take these off after 1 or 2 hours of use as it starts to strain after a period. The offset is you don't get a protective case for your premium priced headphones,I'm a little disappointed at this. Another thing to note is that it is a little bulky to carry around because this headphones cant fold over unlike the majority of headphones cause it is made with aluminium.Overall I'm pretty satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Patience is a virtue
customer_reviews.text: Every B+O product is a work of art [I previously owned a Beocenter 2200 before it died a few yrs ago] I'd had my eye on the H9i Headphone for a while & finally during "Black Friday" wk there they are and using a gift card & my amazon c/card I got it and the Hardcase saving over £200. Yipee for me!
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Poor bluetooth connection and NC
customer_reviews.text: Spotty bluetooth connection, average NC and a automatic play/pause function that doesn't work! A real shame that I've had to return these headphones because I love the build quality, the material used and the replaceable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is pure awesome
customer_reviews.text: Beats Sony and Bose out the park, I love these headphones to bits! Bluetooth is a breeze, its very intuitive and somehow always knows which device I wants to use! I have about 5-6 devices paired with it. Only complaint is that the proximity sensors go off quite often and pause my music from time to time. The solution is to adjust the headphones to the center of your ear and it stops happening. but I have small ears and happens quite often :(
customer_reviews.author: Shaabi

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound and look
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound, amazing design and such good battery life. I love them. The missing star is caused by the fact that the proximity sensors that are supposed to pause the music when you take them off and start when you put them back on are dysfunctional. They are too sensitive, so they stop the music if I look down or sometimes just when I walk. I switched it off in the Beoplay app. I don't need the feature that much, so all in all I am perfectly happy with these beautiful headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ditte Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: ...but a bit expensive. B&O still trading on a superior quality reputation that they maybe no longer deserve? Their stuff in the 80s was a cut above but not sure if that's a reputation they can still leverage the product prices on...?
customer_reviews.author: redcatrockets

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I chose the H9i over Sony and Bose was the build quality, which certainly lives up to the name of the brand. While the controls can be frustrating sometimes, they are not hard to get used to. Also, everything can be done via the phone app. The sound quality is great - maybe slightly heavy on the bass, which I don't mind - and noise-cancellation works perfectly for the average user - it can completely tune out sounds like London boulevard traffic or office background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are just the best headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: I have mainly been a Bose addict, I still am but I can honestly say, these headphones are just as good but I'm afraid to say that the durability of these are better than Bose. They are made from tough aluminium and have a really sturdy feel whilst not compromising on quality. if you want serious sound quality from B&O plus the durability, go for these. I'd get a second pair if I could afford it ! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jason London

customer_reviews.title: Explore the best sound without noice!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box I was amaized! The quality of product is top. It looks nice, sexy and modern. Simpl to connect with any device, very user friendly app available as well... But, the biggest surprise is sound and noise cancellation! This is outstanding! Very efficient on the plane, on the street or just at home... I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Dusan M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with these headphones in fact they are fantastic quality in terms of both sound and build. The remote control function takes a bit of getting used to but works very well once you get used to the swipe angle in relation to head position. The discounted price and availability of replacement parts made this purchase an absolute bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My wife owns a pair of the H9 and these are an improvement in sound and technology, even against her exceptional headphones.
customer_reviews.author: FunkMaster

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful quality headphones. Would get 5 stars except for annoying ‘auto pause’ that keeps stopping the music/video! I managed to turn it off once but it’s back again!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: Utter perfection!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God these are great. I followed a reviewer that said these were simply the best on the market at the moment. He wasn't wrong. Only slight niggle is after perhaps an hour they are quite weird round your head - comfort wise that is! But the sound quality will blow you away that the trade off is more than worth it. Quite expensive but more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AndyL

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the customer service from B&O. At one point of time, I thought the product was running erratic. On working with B&O’s twitter handle, they really helped me understand the process of calibrating the product and getting the best value of it. After all it’s a B&O! The noise cancellation is not as much as Sony and Bose, both of which we have at home... but then it is a trade off for good quality audio.
customer_reviews.author: onlyvips

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best in the market
customer_reviews.text: First set of noise cancelling headphones bought on black Friday. Great sound quality (better with the audio cable) and good at noise cancellation for low, background noises e.g. air-conditioning, traffic, kitchen air vents but not so great at voices. Design and feel is amazing, probably the best in the market for a similar price. Battery life is shorter than some, but charging one a week vs. once a fortnight is no real problem
customer_reviews.author: Neil Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Great sound stage/details failed by the software
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, failed by software. Developed software malfunction after 4 weeks. Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Moe babai

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are almost perfect in every way. The battery life, noise cancellation, sound quality and controls are all perfect. The only issue is the auto pause function. This is supposed to pause music when you take the headphones off and play once you put them back on again. However, this is not the case. They seem to think you’ve taken them when you haven’t. This happens a lot
customer_reviews.author: Dominic McInnes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I am hard of hearing and use the headphones to listen to TV programmes without disturbing other viewers. They serve this purpose extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Raj K Pradhan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The ability to customise the sound, the quality of the sound, design and build, noise cancelling are a new level for me. A few niggles. Still getting used to the touch control. But outstanding nonetheless
customer_reviews.author: Pskidz

customer_reviews.title: To work as per the description.
customer_reviews.text: Old saying,"You get what you pay for" and in this product that is exactly the case. Sounds unbelievable. It allows me to listen to whatever I wish in the same room as my wife watching television. Would strongly recommend you pay that bit more to get the best and this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Comfort, sound quality and intuitive controls make the h9i the best over ear headphones I have ever used the active noise cancellation is maybe not as good as the Bose but the overall package is leagues ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound god awful connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Buy a hammer with it so you can smash it to smithereens when it losses connection and stop the music again, and again, and again, and again!
customer_reviews.author: elliottm79

customer_reviews.title: Stunning headphones
customer_reviews.text: These B&O H9i headphones are simply brilliant. The noise cancelling feature is really efficient and sound quality is exceptional. They represent the best headphones that I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Headphone with Good Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is not on par with Bose or Sony models but the sound performance is bang on. Bought this when there was amazon prime discount so for that reduced price it is worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Jeevan Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Look down on beats wearers
customer_reviews.text: Zero to dislike. Wonderful sounds. Easy to use. Nice look. Feels great on the head.
customer_reviews.author: Elmsy

customer_reviews.title: Quality reliable headphones great sound good looking product
customer_reviews.text: Great product very well made quality product from a top manufacturer of sound instruments
customer_reviews.author: David Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Great design and sound. Seamless connection change between iPhone and MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Rui Martins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent head phones. Very well built with high quality materials. Better than opposition for the same money. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jeremy P. Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Defect battery, good sound quality and fair noice cancellation
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation effect is not as good as my Bose QC25, but the sound quality is excellent. My product battery has defect, the 1st and 2nd charge can reach 90% full only. Bad is there is no stock for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: 1st pair of decent earphones I’ve ever bought and they didn’t disappoint.did not know music sounded this good and the quality of the h9i are fantastic as well ,not plastic like other earphone
customer_reviews.author: George Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just adore these!
customer_reviews.text: Simply I just love these headphones so nothing to complain about.After having Sony's,Bose's,B&W's flagships these fits and sounds best so if you want best and ready to pay few extra these are must have.
customer_reviews.author: Janne Kaartinen

customer_reviews.title: Different colour to advertised
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work great, however, they are a completely different colour to what they’re advertised-instead of the nice beige/cream colour they are a disgusting brown. Very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound great set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound from these headphones, I usually have beats but the noise canceling is much better with these..... pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.author: kay charlton

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: I've owned wh-1000xm3 and can certainly say this is 100x better than it. Excellent Headphones
customer_reviews.author: Seybo

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really like my new headphones. Took a little while to get used to the actions to operate but pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Denise Rudkin

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great product - sound quality and build quality fantastic. Amazing noise cancelling. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ivan J Leah

customer_reviews.title: Not good when you're on the move...
customer_reviews.text: It pauses automatically every few seconds while walking. Terribly annoying and regret buying these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound, variable connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connectivity intermittent. B&O app quite poor re. connectivity also.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shirron

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought as present and was very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and it sounds GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: Great in product design and construction with delicate sound delivered through!
customer_reviews.author: Charliey

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality and comfortably sits on your head .
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brindley

customer_reviews.title: My product has stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: My headphone is not working how do I go about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but accompanied with poor app, ANC and Proximity Sensors
customer_reviews.text: Whilst a fantastic sounding product without enhancement features activated, once these are turned on the sound deteriorates dramatically for a product that costs in excess of its rivals. The Beoplay app is patchy and fails to work numerous times and combined with an ANC function which exerts pressure within the earcup noticeable to use these are then disappointing for what should be wireless noise cancelling headphones. Finally the proximity sensors which should detect when to pause and resume music was found to be unreliable and activating whilst wearing and walking in normal conditions leading to me having to switch it off to enjoy continued use which again from B&O should have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: The design , comfort and noise cancellation. Not good, no case include, only simple bag
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Loved Everything But Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I also own the Bose QC 35II and felt these were better in every regard except comfort. The way these fit over my ears caused discomfort in less than 30 minutes. It’s too bad because these were at least as good in noise cancellation, if not better, sounded better and better features but the Bose were more comfortable. If you have larger ears these may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: JC III

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design and interfacing. Features glich. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible headphones. Noise cancellation not that good mainly because of style of "over ear" design doesn't cover ear properly. If you turn your head it pauses your music or video. So many thing caused random pauses constantly. It was awful. Finally and the worst part is they were so uncomfortable on ears and top of head. Couldn't wear for more than two hour and had to stop for a few hours. Which the whole reason i get them is for long flights. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Alan W.

customer_reviews.title: a great improvement from the last generation H9's
customer_reviews.text: I had the Beoplay H9 before getting these H9i. There are definitely some solid improvements between the two. The touch features on the side have been greatly improved and run more seamlessly. The bass and sound quality are enhanced with the bass becoming tighter and 'punchier', a great improvement from the last generation H9's. The ANC is also significantly improved from the H9's. When using the H9's you would have some ambient noise still leak through but that's mostly been eliminated with the H9i's. Overall I think there are some excellent improvements between the two and well worth the jump to the H9i.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Good but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful design and high quality materials, BUT: - Wore for a transatlantic flight - although initially comfortable, the weight causes increasing discomfort after 3-4 hours of continuous wear; - Normal head movements caused disruption of noise cancelation feature; - The touch controls are not consistent.
customer_reviews.author: AgneS

customer_reviews.title: Good sound; not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good sound, noise cancelling feature, and comfortable. Cons: the auto pause/start doesnt work even with the new firmware. The transparent mode pauses the music, no point to that feature since you can simple take off the headphones. Unlike Bose, you cant adjust noise cancelling level. Unlike Bowers and Willkins, you cant adjust the transparency level of sounds around you.
customer_reviews.author: Adam O

customer_reviews.title: Be sure the you understand the bluetooth sync settings.
customer_reviews.text: I love the headphones but at first I doubted they worked correctly. After I read the instructions and went to B&O’s support site I understood the issue. The headphones need to calibrate off of your head first before you put them on. There is a feature that will stop the music when you remove them. This was not working due to me just turning them on and putting them on my head. The issue was the music would randomly stop. After turning on the headphones and waiting for the power light to turn from green to off before putting them on solved everything. Great sound, fit, and battery life. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Neal McFee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones, even for the hefty price tag!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones, even for the hefty price tag. Phenomenal design and build quality, great sound, app is very nifty as it allows you to customize the sound quality. Allows for quick firmware update. Quick delivery too. My only small complaint is that the transparency mode doesn't work as well as I thought it would (or as I remember it doing when I first tested another version in the B&O retail store. When I switch to transparency mode, it works well for 2 seconds and amplifies the surroundings' audio, but then gets a bit muted. Effectively doing little to enhance the volume of what's going on beyond what I could hear if I simply switch off ANC.
customer_reviews.author: Majd Khaldi

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Travel Companion!
customer_reviews.text: These wonderful sounding headphones are the perfect travel companion for anyone that frequently finds themselves jetting across the country for a living. Nothing but music on noisy aircraft! Oh yea, and they are great for listening around the house too (unless you have someone that is speaking to you, because with the noise canceling technology and pristine audio, you won't be able to hear them!)
customer_reviews.author: Brett Casadonte

customer_reviews.title: Best comfort and sound
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable over ear ANC headphones. Best sounding over ear bluetooth headphones. ANC is good enough, but Bose QC35 has better ANC if you are looking for that. Battery life is only 16 hours, where headphones half the price get up to 24 hours. The automatic play/pause detection is horrendous, so best just to turn that off. From the support site: "To disable the automatic play/pause function, move the switch to the top position and hold for 2 seconds until the indicator light flashes blue. Then, double tap the center of touchpad on the right headphone and the indicator light will turn red. To re-enable, repeat the same steps until the indicator light turns green."
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Heucke

customer_reviews.title: Distorted sound quality. Weak bass.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful headphones. Battery is not charging properly. Light was green but both my phone and app state it’s not even half charged. Unfortunately, the flat sound seems like you can never get to a good groove that much cheaper cans provide. The ones that were delivered to me produced a lot of distortion therefore I had to return these.
customer_reviews.author: TechReviews78

customer_reviews.title: Look amazing! Sound good
customer_reviews.text: My QC35’s will still be my go to headsets when traveling (flying, or long rides). That said, I’m a 5’5” woman... and I’m not a fan of the massive look that the QC’ give off. The sound quality is not as good as the Bose. But they are still really good, and the visual aesthetic is insane! I suggest downloading the app and changing the sound. Initially the highs can be piercing, but after changing the sound in the app it was better.
customer_reviews.author: 2Rud3

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, can get uncomfortable after long use
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great and adjustable with the Beoplay app. The noise cancelling is solid. I wear them at work, and few times have not even realized when someone is next to me asking a question. Great way to zone in at work or zone out at home. On top of this, the design is super cool. I'm docking a little bit here because they do kind of hurt my ears after prolonged use. That said, my ears tend to respond to every pair of headphones I've owned in the same way after prolonged used, so maybe it's just me. All in all, I would buy these headphones again,
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, touch controls lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Sound excellent. I used to work for a speaker manufacture, so I may be more critical than most. Having said that, these are some of the best sounding headphones I've ever owned. My only issue is with the touch controls. You can't really lie down and listen to music because they pause at the slightest contact with the pillow. (Maybe it's on any movement?) But it's irritating. Other than that, I love them.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a year
customer_reviews.text: I got these for Christmas 2018 and for the price you would think the manufacture would stand behind the product for at least a year. About 2 months ago the Left speaker went out. Now I can not even find support. For almost 500.00 you think they would last for a minimum of 5 years, 100 dollars a year is what I figure. Save your money and by some Villians there only $25.00 or so and if they last as long as my Beoplay H9i I would not be so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: Everything is excellent. You get used to the touch functions over time. The only thing that failed for me was the auto pause, that happens randomly (I waited for the light to go off when turning on). It didn’t matter to me because I turned that function off and don’t really matter to have lost it.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Garbage functionality (but decent sound)
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are basically garbage, though they do sound nice when they work. The "feature" that pauses the sound when you take them off your head kicks in all the time, stopping my music when I'm just walking down the street. I simply can't get them to play continuously. Also, it's possible to turn off the noise canceling, but it turns on every time you start the headphones, so you'll have to that every time if you don't like noise canceling. I'd return them but don't have the box anymore — what can I do? I used to have Beoplay H4 would like to get a pair of those instead.
customer_reviews.author: tristanp

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully warm sound, excellent sound stage for the music I mostly listen to, Classical & Jazz
customer_reviews.text: I have tried some over-ear headphones with limited success as they press too hard on my ears for me. These Beoplay H9i's are comfortable to wear and I can stand them on my head for long periods of time - more than 3 hours at a time. The sound quality is warm and full. The Beoplay app that accompanies these headphones is simple, not fully featured, but does the job. B&O is rightly regarded as a high-quality builder of audio equipment. These headphones are a bit pricy, but with the special offer running at the moment, well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones under $500
customer_reviews.text: I was dreaming about these headphones from the day i tried it out at the airport. However the price was biting. And finally it comes with a good discount on Amazon and i get them. What a great sound quality. Same as in my car with B&O sound system. And headphones sits on the head very well, no pushing on ears, nor the head. I may wear it all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have the Sennheiser HD1s and an older set of Bose over the ear noise reduction headphones. The sound quality on the B&O is excellent and similar to the Senheisers. Controls are a little wonky. But the real difference maker for me is the comfort. I cN wear these for hours without them crushing my ears. Both the others would create fatigue and the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dezso

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cans
customer_reviews.text: I had a on ear sennheiser momentum 1. I am comparing h9i with m1. Sound: (subjective) Awesome. Sound is crisp and clear. Bass is adequate the sound is wide. Build: Solid and sturdy. Comfortable for those not wearing glasses. I wear glasses and at times will feel the earpads pressing on the frame. Batt life: So far I have pushed it to 20hours before charging. Could last longer,just too lazy to push it. Touch control: No issue for me though it does takes a few minutes of practice. App: More customization preferred. In general this is an awesome cans. Sound really good and feels sturdy. The slight issues encountered can be easily ignored.
customer_reviews.author: Ng Koon Peng

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage build quality. Pulled it from the box and charged the unit. Connected it to device and the beoplay app indicated an update was available. Initiating the update fried the electronic components and the headphones dont work. A product this expensive should not have such poor construction quality. Now for the always fun return through the mail process. 🙄🙄
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be aware when ordering Natural color
customer_reviews.text: I just received by H9i (Natural) and the color is WAY OFF!!! See picture for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chan

customer_reviews.title: average headphones for a not so average price
customer_reviews.text: pros: -removable batteries -easily removable ear pads -(subjective) sounds better than the wh1000xm3 -“luxurious” feeling i.e. lambskin ear pads and non plastic parts cons and oks: -average ANC -average battery life (around 22 hours real time uses which is still pretty good but there are cheaper cans out there with better battery life) -HOLY **** if you have big ears these headphones will try to squeeze the living hell out of them like you owe it money. Recommend you order the H7 earpads to replace the ones it comes with, they are much thicker and deeper
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: very Impressive sound stage for a closed can.
customer_reviews.text: They sound really good. Actually probably the best closed can ive heard. I just wish the transparency mode let me listen to music while it was on. Noise canceling seemed good but am new to that sorta technology, so don't take my word for these when it comes to that. also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great on the headphones from sound quality to noise cancellation however the added feature of your headphones pausing whenever you put them down makes this product completely unusable. If you hold still too long your music pauses. if you're sitting down and stand up your music pauses. if you glance in any direction your music pauses. Horrible feature and completely ruins a great pair of headphones firmware update does not fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Can't use controller on actual headphone.  Basically all you can do is pause the thing.
customer_reviews.text: You can only turn off the noise cancellation within the B&O app. Can't advance or rewind songs via the actual headphones, EXTREMELY ANNOYING and not useful at all. I have the H4 headphones which are far superior to these because you can actually control your music. They get 2 stars because as a set of headphones to put on and do nothing but watch tv with noise cancelling they work great, but they aren't any good for anything else. Poor design around functionality.
customer_reviews.author: M T

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to receiving the H9i. It came today and looks like I got a defective unit. Neither the ANC or transparency mode work. The touch controls also were really glitchy too.
customer_reviews.author: Rashid

customer_reviews.title: One MAJOR flaw...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great. The fit and feel are great. Build quality is great. But the “touch sensor controls” literally suck. I have never been so frustrated just adjusting the volume up and down. If a firmware upgrade can’t fix this problem, I strongly suggest B&O’s R&D people take a look at something people will actually be able to use consistently - like buttons and switches.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Such A Shame
customer_reviews.text: SUDDENLY STOPPED WORKING AFTER 4 MONTHS So I have been in love with these headphones. The ANC is pretty meh, and the proximity sensor is a god damn nightmare, however sound quality is unparalleled at this price point. Hell, it's unparalleled at most price points, f***ing incredible sound. HOWEVER, today for no reason that I can surmise, the headphones stopped turning on. I plugged them in and not even the typical charge light is showing. Nothing. I will update my review to the 5 stars it should be when I hear back from B&O about this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: You have to pull your phone out for any type of google qustions that sucks how ever 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Sorry i have to change my review the head phones after one week of using did work properly do not waste your money

customer_reviews.title: Fancy, comfortable, but not satisfying.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for its 's so comfortable, h9i has the undoubtedly best design and material, but the auto-pause is so stupid that it pauses 10 times in a minute so I have to turn off this function, that's why I give 3 stars. The ANC is okay but not as good as sony or bose, but the sound quality with the ANC on is not satisfying, the other problem is that h9i doesn't have Aptx bluetooth connection, onlt AAC, so it will be not good if you do not have an iphone as the player.
customer_reviews.author: Meng Huang

customer_reviews.title: Multiple source connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and excellent sound quality but most importantly, it connects to multiple sources. That is one very important feature my sony wh-1000xm3 doesn’t offer. In comparison, the sony’s are more comfortable with better battery life. The touch controls on the sony also work better but the b&o offer better sound quality, comparable noise cancellation and multiple source connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: gogogadget

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing! The sound quality, the material, and the comfort are truly unmatched in my opinion. I'm an audiophile and have owned numerous Headphones in the $300-$400 range (Bose quiet comfort 2, the new Sony headphones that compete with that, and the Audio Technica ATR headphones which are about $350). None of them compare to the sound of these headphones! Highly recommend! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Anderer

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a couple caveats
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic headphones with a lot of pluses, the biggest three being the material quality (very solid), the built in USB dac (plug it into your PC and listen with higher sound quality!), and the removable battery (battery starting to die after a couple years? get a new one!). I love the multi device support as well. The touch controls can be a little finicky until you get used to them, and AptX support is lacking which is a little bit of a bummer, but over USB the sound quality is great. Range could be a little bit better but is still pretty decent. I get maybe 50 feet out of it with a couple thin walls in between.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Damn great pair of Bluetooth over the ear Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I had an older pair of B&O H8 headphones for about 2-3 years that I enjoyed - Updated to the H9i's recently and they sound great. I travel a lot so they help remove the airplane noise as well as screaming babies and attach to the bluetooth of my iPhone and iPad at the same time without problems. I feel that the get better as they burn ing 10-30 hours of use like my H8's did. These sound great - give great response across the whole spectrum. These and the Sennheiser's are my favorite - Lastly, they travel well and are very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Laff

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and ID design
customer_reviews.text: This headset is awesome! The sound quality is very good! Compare with Bose and other brand, it sounds more crispy and clear. (Unbelievably crispy and clear) Bose & other brand r more soft and less impress. The noise canceling may not completely reduce the noise from outside. Not sure if it is b/c I am wearing glasses. However, when I put it on, I can totally feel the different. The design and material it used is soooooooo nice and I am very very very happy about it! Worth of the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jecy

product_meta.title: Bang & Olufsen Beoplay H9i Wireless Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones with Active Noise Cancellation, Transparency Mode and Microphone – Black - 1645026
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Designed to move with you, H9i headphones are packed with convenient features and luxurious materials. These over-ear headphones feature advanced hybrid Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) to reduce both high- and low-frequency background noises such as traffic or human voices. With hybrid ANC, you can fully immerse yourself in rich, authentic Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound.

Perfect for commuting, H9i headphones have an innovative aluminum touch interface that lets you control volume, track selection and more with simple gestures. Transparency Mode allows you to tune in, or out, of your surroundings with a simple swipe of the touchpad and an intuitive proximity sensor stops playback when you remove your headphones, resuming play when you put them back on. With an intelligent battery saving function, these headphones are ideal for traveling, offering up to 18 hours of playtime when using Bluetooth and ANC. An easily replaceable battery is integrated into the ear cup, so you can keep the beat going on even longer journeys.

To expand your sound, these wireless headphones can be easily paired with up to two devices at once. With an impressive 121-foot Bluetooth range, you aren’t tethered to your source and can move freely while still enjoying seamless music streaming. H9i is also compatible with the Beoplay App, where you can control the ANC function and customize tonal ranges. This lets you match your listening experience to your activity, whether you’re commuting, enjoying a podcast or just relaxing.

Designed by Danish industrial designer Jakob Wagner, Beoplay H9i headphones are crafted with luxurious materials, ensuring they look as good as they sound. The cowhide leather headband, memory foam/lambskin ear cushions, and anodized aluminum discs deliver lightweight strength, clean modern style and exceptional sound quality. With a sophisticated over-ear design that envelops ears for comfortable, all-day wear, these headphones are made for serious on-the-go music lovers.
feature_bullets: EASY LISTENING: Adjust the volume, change tracks and take calls with on-device touch controls. Enjoy added convenience with the proximity sensor that pauses playback when headphones are removed and resumes when placed back on.
